attributes.action: do more to protect adults from having to provide ID to buy alcohol
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Customers, of supermarkets and off-licences, whom are obviously over
21 should not be asked for ID to buy alcohol. Yet many supermarkets
refuse to serve over 21's if they can't provide proof of age ID (which
costs money to acquire).

To ask someone in the 30's or 40's for proof of age ID when they are
not carrying any is a humiliating and frustrating experience.

The Government should do more to stop the middle aged being forced to
carry proof of age ID if they happen to decide, perhaps on the off
chance or whim, to do some shopping which includes products restricted
to the over 18's.
